executive_summary: The meat jerky industry has proven resilient despite COVID-19 pressures, with revenue growth in 2020 driven by e-commerce and retail partnerships. Rising meat prices boosted revenue, but falling disposable income in 2022 forced producers to absorb costs, cutting profit. Overall industry revenue grew at a 1.7% CAGR over the past five years and is expected to reach $982.9 million in 2024. Jerky benefits from demand for protein snacks, but concerns about red meat prompted launches of plant-based and artisanal products. While disposable income will climb through 2029, falling meat prices will pressure production. Revenue is forecast to dip at a 0.2% CAGR over the next five years to $974.5 million.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Health-conscious consumers drive demand for high-protein snacks
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past five years, many consumers have become more health-conscious, leading to an increased demand for high-protein snacks, including meat jerky. Consumers are seeking snacks that align with their health goals, such as weight management and muscle building, making meat jerky an attractive option because of its high protein and low carbohydrate content.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The swelling influence of clean-label and natural ingredients heighten demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Another major trend affecting the meat jerky industry is the rising demand for clean-label products that use natural ingredients. Consumers are becoming more health-conscious and prefer snacks that are free from artificial preservatives, colors and flavors.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Innovation in flavors and premiumization attract new customers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past five years, meat jerky producers have seen significant flavor profile innovations, moving beyond traditional offerings like original and teriyaki to more exotic and unique flavors such as smoked chipotle, Korean BBQ and honey sriracha. Companies also focus on premiumization, offering artisanal and gourmet jerky made with high-quality cuts of meat and natural, non-GMO ingredients.

The growth of e-commerce platforms has simplified purchasing meat jerky, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic, when online shopping surged. Consumers found it easier to access various products, contributing to a significant shift in buying habits towards digital platforms.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Innovations in preservation technology enhancing product quality
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Advances in preservation and packaging technology have extended the shelf life of meat jerky products while maintaining taste and texture. This has improved product quality and consumer satisfaction.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Wholesaler bypass is expected to become more prevalent
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Meat jerky producers are shifting to direct-to-retailer sales, bypassing wholesalers. The trend aligns with broader industry efforts to streamline supply chains and respond more quickly to market demands. By cutting out the middleman, producers can charge slightly higher prices to buyers and maintain greater control over their distribution processes.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Dropping meat prices will likely stifle growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry's revenue growth through the end of 2029 is primarily constrained by declining red meat prices. The pricing trend is the main factor that has hampered profitability and will continue to do so over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Competition is expected to heat up
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: PepsiCo and Kraft Heinz, leading corporations in competitive sectors, are adjusting to consumer preferences for healthier snacks. These companies acknowledge the growing trend towards health-conscious choices, prompting them to innovate and expand their product ranges to meet this demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The expansion of plant-based alternatives poses a potential threat
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The plant-based movement firmly establishes itself in the snack world, with companies offering plant-based "jerky" made from mushrooms, soy and other substitutes. As these alternatives improve in taste and texture, they will likely take away part of the traditional beef jerky market.

industry_definition: This industry includes establishments that cut, pack and box meat jerky from purchased meats. Meat jerky includes meat that has been cut into long slices or strips and dried, seasoned or otherwise cured.
key_trends: Meat jerky producers vie for key contracts with large retailers. Major companies gain an edge by securing precious shelf space and enhancing their market presence and sales.
Jerky products need competitive pricing to stay attractive, especially during economic downturns. Lower disposable income drives consumers to choose more budget-friendly snack options.
Jerky producers have raised prices due to increased meat costs, leading to higher revenue. Adjusting to heightened input costs allows them to maintain profitability.
Consumers seek healthy snacks, positioning jerky well as a protein option. However, competition from other snack industries may limit growth.

Link Snacks thrived through the pandemic. Through extensive research, they maintained consumer loyalty despite reduced foot traffic in brick-and-mortar stores, earning the title of Category Captain for alternative snacks.
Conagra's revenue stabilized as it forged strong relationships with key clients and optimized its e-commerce channels. Through strategic online efforts, Conagra experienced significant growth.
The FDA and USDA enforce strict sanitation, handling and labeling laws for meat jerky producers. These regulations protect consumers and ensure product safety.

Government grants such as value-added producer grants (VAPG) and agricultural marketing service (AMS) offer essential funding to jerky producers. These grants help companies develop new, in-demand products and expand operations.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Many retailers strategically place jerky products to promote impulse buying by on-the-go consumers. This tactic aims to capitalize on convenience, making it easier for shoppers to grab a quick snack while shopping.

Large supermarket chains, convenience stores and warehouse clubs are the single most important point of purchase for consumers, so it's imperative that jerky producers maintain solid relationships with them.
Convenience stores represent one of the most prominent outlets for meat jerky and related snack products. When demand from these retailers increases, industry revenue also grows.

Large supermarket chains, convenience stores and warehouse clubs are the single most important point of purchase for consumers, so it's imperative that jerky producers maintain solid relationships with them.

products_and_services.product_or_service: GAME JERKY (E.G. DEER, ELK, SALMON AND BUFFALO)

products_and_services.product_description: Lean meat from cattle that has been trimmed of fat, cut into strips and dried to prevent spoilage is by far the most popular jerky product. Because of its popularity, beef jerky is also the most diverse segment.

tier_1_suppliers: Meat, Beef & Poultry Processing in the US
Seasoning, Sauce and Condiment Production in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Laminated Plastics Manufacturing in the US
Beef Cattle Production in the US
Hog & Pig Farming in the US
Chicken & Turkey Meat Production in the US
tier_2_buyers: Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US
Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Convenience stores significantly drive the sales of meat jerky and snack products
demand_determinants.determinant_description: When these retailers see increased demand, industry revenue rises accordingly.

international_trade_points.trade_description: International trade surged after the pandemic, driven by pent-up demand.

international_trade_points.trade_title: E-commerce's rise allows consumers to easily purchase jerky from overseas
international_trade_points.trade_description: This development makes a wider range of international jerky products accessible, enhancing consumer choices.
Consumers seek unique and adventurous taste experiences, leading to a demand for a wide range of flavors in meat jerky.
A surge in exports as international trade boomed in 2021 is partially responsible for the massive surge in revenue during that year.
The US dollar's value, measured by the Trade-Weighted Index (TWI), spiked in 2022 compared to other major currencies.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The TWI is set to decline through the end of 2029
international_trade_points.trade_description: The TWI is set to decline through the end of 2029, promoting US jerky in overseas markets.

business_locations.location_description: Because of its proximity to upstream farms and downstream consumer markets, the Great Lakes region has more meat jerky producers than any other region.
Meat jerky producers with establishments in the Southeast region can better service the region's massive population.
Like the Great Lakes, the Plains region is a crucial hub for many of the United States' agricultural industries.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Food and Drug Administration and the US Department of Agriculture set and enforce regulations to ensure product quality.
The Environmental Protection Agency requires jerky producers to treat their waste and manage pollution.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Jerky production has high capital intensity.
New jerky producers must navigate federal food safety and processing regulations and comply with waste regulations.
Acquiring machinery and obtaining high-quality ingredients requires significant capital.
New producers find it challenging to stand out in the crowded jerky market dominated by large, established brands.
Ongoing reinvestment in production and distribution often deters new entrants due to the significant capital required.

factors_increased_barrier: Jerky production has high capital intensity.
factors_decreased_barrier: The technology change level is low.
The globalization level is low and steady.

basis_points.basis_title: Meat jerky producers vie for key contracts with large retailers
basis_points.basis_description: Major companies gain an edge by securing precious shelf space and enhancing their market presence and sales.
Lower disposable income drives consumers to choose more budget-friendly snack options.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Large companies have established relationships and contracts with major convenience store chains, strengthening market presence.
Large companies are known for solid reputations in producing quality jerky products, fostering consumer loyalty.
Major companies enjoy significant economies of scale, allowing them to produce goods at lower costs per unit.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Declining revenue makes managing fixed costs challenging
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Declining revenue makes managing fixed costs, such as utilities and rent, challenging for jerky producers.
Rising wage expenses are squeezing profit for jerky producers, posing significant challenges to the industry.
Jerky producers employ various specialized machines to enhance productivity and ensure consistency in the final product.
Jerky production demands significant capital to maintain specialized machinery and facilities.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Jerky production demands significant capital to maintain specialized machinery and facilities.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Meat jerky is frequently sold as a grab-and-go item in convenience stores.
The price of red meat is one of the industry's key inputs, so rising meat prices will force jerky producers to lift prices.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: NEW FLAVORS CAPTURE DEMAND FOR DIVERSITY
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Consumers' interest in international flavors and cuisines is rising.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: PLANT-BASED JERKY ADAPTS TO CONSUMER SENTIMENT
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The vegan population in the US is steadily growing.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports? How does your company compete effectively with imported products?
FAQs.answer: Imported jerky products have become another source of competition for companies in this industry.

FAQs.question: Have exports offered an opportunity for your company? How does your company market effectively to international customers?
FAQs.answer: Though still limited, greater appreciation for jerky abroad has presented an opportunity for some producers in terms of export sales.

FAQs.question: Is your company located near key downstream distributors to reduce shipping costs? Is your company in close proximity to upstream farms and meat suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Companies in this industry locate themselves near major distributors to lower shipping costs.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Consumer preferences have forced companies in this industry to develop all-natural and more health conscious products.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to safeguard your company's proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Recipes and production methods are regularly patented in this industry.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: While wages have grown in this industry, companies in this industry have made investments towards automating production.

FAQs.question: Is your company adequately prepared to comply with new environmental standards?
FAQs.answer: Meat processing of any sort involves biological waste, which is regulated by the EPA.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Like all manufacturing workplaces, companies in this industry are subject to oversight from OSHA.

FAQs.question: How often does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: As the industry and demand for its product grows, companies will need to make expansion plans.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins in Meat Jerky Production are competitive, bolstered by efficient operations and a strong market presence.

FAQs.question: How specialized is your product selection? What niche markets do you serve that larger competitors do not?
FAQs.answer: In an industry that is highly competitive, operators use product differentiation to reduce direct competition.

FAQs.question: Do you have beneficial relationships with upstream suppliers? How can you increase your company's vertical integration?
FAQs.answer: A steady supply of healthy livestock is essential for achieving maximum capacity utilization.

FAQs.question: Are you able to leverage economies of scale?
FAQs.answer: Larger operations are more profitable than small plants.

FAQs.question: Do you track trends in red meat prices? What are some ways to market your products to boost revenue when meat prices are low?
FAQs.answer: The price of red meat is important to industry operators.

FAQs.question: In what ways will your business benefit from the expected increase in consumer spending? How do you monitor changes in consumer spending?
FAQs.answer: Meat products are more expensive than other snack foods made from dairy, grains or vegetables.

FAQs.question: How much of your revenue is earned from convenience store sales? Do you rely on any other sales outlet to turn a profit?
FAQs.answer: Convenience stores represent one of the most prominent outlets for meat jerky and related snack products.
